text:
Hey friends!

You must've heard about the rise of Product-Led Growth -- the idea that products (above MARKETING & sales) should be the primary driver to get customers.

Is that true? That's the question I sought to answer when I began researching this article. My findings revealed that, while being PLG is a good thing, it doesn't replace (or stands above) content marketing.

However, I also found that if product is at the forefront of acquiring new SaaS users, then content marketing has to adjust into what I termed: Product-Led Storytelling.

I pieced everything into this article, showing how Product-Led Storytelling trumps PLG with examples:

<https://victoreduoh.com/product-led-storytelling-trumps-product-led-growth/>

attachments.title: 3 SaaS Brands Show Product-led Storytelling Trumps Product-Led Growth
attachments.text: 3 SaaS brands show how product-led storytelling drives predictable product adoption & growth over Product-Led Growth.
attachments.fallback: 3 SaaS Brands Show Product-led Storytelling Trumps Product-Led Growth

elements.text:
Hey friends!

You must've heard about the rise of Product-Led Growth -- the idea that products (above MARKETING & sales) should be the primary driver to get customers.

Is that true? That's the question I sought to answer when I began researching this article. My findings revealed that, while being PLG is a good thing, it doesn't replace (or stands above) content marketing.

However, I also found that if product is at the forefront of acquiring new SaaS users, then content marketing has to adjust into what I termed: Product-Led Storytelling.

I pieced everything into this article, showing how Product-Led Storytelling trumps PLG with examples:

text: I have to quibble with your post a bit. I’d challenge anyone to show me a company where they can demonstrate more leads came from content marketing than the product over the course of several months. Even some of the examples here are tenuous. Like the Docsend one seems to about a singular article that you found rather than the impact of content as a whole on their business (I.e. Because it helped YOU is not proof that content is outpacing product as a source of growth). Additionally your Mailchimp example relies on traffic. Traffic ≠ revenue (just ask news websites!).
